required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Investigate Efficacy and Safety of Pemetrexed as Second or Third Line Therapy in Patients With Non-small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
clinical_study.official_title: LY231514 500 mg/m2 and LY231514 1000 mg/m2 in Patients With Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Who Were Previously Treated With Prior Systemic Anti Cancer Therapy: A Randomized Phase II Trial

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate efficacy and safety of pemetrexed as second or third line therapy in patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease (up to 3.2 years)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: time of response to progressive disease (up to 3.2 years)
baseline to measured progressive disease (up to 3.2 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 3 Months in Quality of Life Questionnaire for Cancer Patients Treated With Anticancer Drugs (QOL-ACD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre-dose), 3 Months after first dose of Cycle 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 3 Months in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy for Lung Cancer (FACT-L) Lung Cancer Subscale (LCS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre-dose), 3 Months after first dose of Cycle 1

intervention.description: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days, one year from registration date
1000 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days, one year from registration date

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical stage III or IV
- Previously treated with one or two chemotherapeutic regimens
- Performance status: 0-2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability or unwillingness to take folic acid or vitamin B12 supplementation

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Baseline demographics and efficacy outcome measures are provided for the Full Analysis Set population (all randomized participants who met all inclusion and no exclusion criteria and received at least one dose of study drug).

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
measure.description: Classifies patients according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0 (Fully Active) to 5 (Death).

outcome.title: Best Overall Response
outcome.description: Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria as determined by the Case Judgment Committee. Best overall response was defined as the most favorable overall response recorded for each patient during the observation period. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease (up to 3.2 years)
outcome.population: Full analysis set: all randomized participants who met all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria and received at least one dose of study drug.

measure.title: Best Overall Response
measure.description: Response using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria as determined by the Case Judgment Committee. Best overall response was defined as the most favorable overall response recorded for each patient during the observation period. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria.
measure.population: Full analysis set: all randomized participants who met all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria and received at least one dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Duration of Response
outcome.description: The duration of a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) was defined as the time from first objective status assessment of CR or PR to the first time of progression.
outcome.time_frame: time of response to progressive disease (up to 3.2 years)
outcome.population: Full analysis set: all randomized participants who met all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria and received at least one dose of study drug.

measure.title: Duration of Response
measure.description: The duration of a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) was defined as the time from first objective status assessment of CR or PR to the first time of progression.
measure.population: Full analysis set: all randomized participants who met all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria and received at least one dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: PFS was defined as time from the scheduled date of the first treatment cycle until the date of confirmation of progressive disease on the overall response rating. For patients who died before confirmation of progressive disease, the number of days until the date of death (from any cause) was handled as progression-free survival.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease (up to 3.2 years)
outcome.population: Full analysis set: all randomized participants who met all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria and received at least one dose of study drug.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: PFS was defined as time from the scheduled date of the first treatment cycle until the date of confirmation of progressive disease on the overall response rating. For patients who died before confirmation of progressive disease, the number of days until the date of death (from any cause) was handled as progression-free survival.
measure.population: Full analysis set: all randomized participants who met all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria and received at least one dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 3 Months in Quality of Life Questionnaire for Cancer Patients Treated With Anticancer Drugs (QOL-ACD)
outcome.description: 20-items assessed quality of life in patients undergoing chemotherapy. Scores range from 1 (not at all/very poor) to 5 (very much/very well). Face scale scores (patient circles number of the face that best fits his/her feelings) range from 1 (sad face) to 5 (smiling face). Item scores were grouped according to Functional (daily activity: 5 items), Physical (5 items), Emotional (psychological condition: 4 items), Social Attitude (5 items), and Face Scale (1 item). Score of subscales were converted to scores with range from 0 to 100. Higher scores represent higher QOL.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre-dose), 3 Months after first dose of Cycle 1
outcome.population: Full analysis set: all randomized participants who met all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria and received at least one dose of study drug.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to 3 Months in Quality of Life Questionnaire for Cancer Patients Treated With Anticancer Drugs (QOL-ACD)
measure.description: 20-items assessed quality of life in patients undergoing chemotherapy. Scores range from 1 (not at all/very poor) to 5 (very much/very well). Face scale scores (patient circles number of the face that best fits his/her feelings) range from 1 (sad face) to 5 (smiling face). Item scores were grouped according to Functional (daily activity: 5 items), Physical (5 items), Emotional (psychological condition: 4 items), Social Attitude (5 items), and Face Scale (1 item). Score of subscales were converted to scores with range from 0 to 100. Higher scores represent higher QOL.
measure.population: Full analysis set: all randomized participants who met all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria and received at least one dose of study drug.

class.title: Face Scale Change from Baseline (n=58, n=60)

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 3 Months in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy for Lung Cancer (FACT-L) Lung Cancer Subscale (LCS)
outcome.description: FACT-L LCS measured health-related quality of life (HR-QL) related to additional concerns of lung cancer. Original LCS subscale scores range from 0 to 28, but the scores were converted to scores with a range of 0 to 100 in this study. Higher scores represent better HR-QL.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre-dose), 3 Months after first dose of Cycle 1
outcome.population: Full analysis set: all randomized participants who met all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria and received at least one dose of study drug.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to 3 Months in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy for Lung Cancer (FACT-L) Lung Cancer Subscale (LCS)
measure.description: FACT-L LCS measured health-related quality of life (HR-QL) related to additional concerns of lung cancer. Original LCS subscale scores range from 0 to 28, but the scores were converted to scores with a range of 0 to 100 in this study. Higher scores represent better HR-QL.
measure.population: Full analysis set: all randomized participants who met all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria and received at least one dose of study drug.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
